name: Grand Sunset Princess All Suites Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Grand Sunset Princess is a beautiful massive property. My sister and I traveled together and based on some reviews we read, we upgraded to Platinum when we booked our reservations. We are so glad that we did this. Upon arrival, we were served champaign. We arrived at 4pm so we checked in and got our room right away. The rooms were clean, not spic N span but still clean. There was not always enough wash cloths but they did come make up the room and clean towels every day. The platinum bar/lounge was awesome as they always had a little something there to snack on…fruit, pastry, sandwiches, nachos, candy, etc. Platinum has its own pool which was awesome….not crowded. The shuttle ran from the main building to platinum about every 15 minutes.
reviews.title: "Sisters vacation at Grand Sunset Princess"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We ate at the buffet 3 nights and got reservations for the other restaurants the last 4 nights. We thought the buffets were just fine; there is something for everyone’s taste and each night they have a different theme. You have to remember though, you are in a foreign country; the food is not going to taste exactly as it does here. The four restaurants we chose were seafood, fondue, Mexican, and hibachi grill. They were all tasty and enjoyable.
reviews.title: It's a deal for a reason!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: A couple things that we did and enjoyed; we upgraded our massage from ½ hr to an hour deep tissue massage and we went to two of the shows. We also reserved the shuttle to go into town but chose to take taxi back. We enjoyed our vacation immensely.
reviews.title: Awesome!! Loved this Place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I got many mosquito bites so when going, take and USE mosquito repellent. We took it but failed to use it every day. I did not see any bugs in our room with the exception of a moth one night. I did see a dead roach outside and one in the pool one day. Remember you are in a warm climate where these live; it appears that they are keeping the place clean and taking the precautions that are necessary to keep any bugs at bay. Absoluted enjoyed vacation and loved the place!
reviews.title: Going back in 4 months

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Boy I wish I had llstened to those "bad" reviews..but I convinced myself that there are alot of negative people out there..whom you simply cannot please. The resort is huge, beautiful and has well kept and clean grounds. Our room had an ant infestation problem we had ants all over our things within minutes of arriving! When I called the front desk they sent someone to spray the next morning (and the room smelled of poison of course)... The beach smelled HORRIBLE and was brown...disgusting...the beaches near the pier for cozumel were beautiful and clear...if you have any sense listen to what others have experienced do you and your family a favor and spend the xtra $$$ on a nice hotel near the pier you won't regret it. GSP food is aweful..blah ...the only edible meal was at Miso which get books fast. Guys this place is cheap for a reason :(
reviews.title: Great resort and would go back tomorrow!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the GSP from July 12-19 and had a great time.
reviews.title: What a Great Vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Rooms: The rooms very very clean had a wonderful bathroom. Everything in the Jr. Suite Deluxe contained marble floors, a huge king bed and plenty of room. The maid service was great and done by noon each day. The mini bar was restocked with water, pop, and beer each day. It can be difficult to get extra towls.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Service: We were amazed at how hard these people work all day at the resort. All service members were really friendly and did their best to meet all needs. You would have to wait a bit at the busy times for drinks at the swim up or beach bar, but the the drinks were great. The entertainment staff was amazing with activities and shows all day. They were great with our nine year old daughter.
reviews.title: What more could you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: Food: The buffetts were average to above average. Breakfast was especially good. We grew a little tired of the buffett food by the end of the week. The specialties were good we really liked the mexican and the itialian.
reviews.title: Hotel is definitely up there with Iberostar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beach: The view at the beach was amazing. Plenty of chairs and places to set up for the day. White sand and clear water, loved it. The first 20 feet is filled with rocks so bring waters shoes, but we walked down to the next resort and it was three times as bad there.
reviews.title: Best trip we have ever taken!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort was great. Very clean and very fancy, defiantly 5 star quality. My husband and I stayed here along with another couple. The a la cartes were delicious. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the suites which I would highly recommend. When staying in the suites you have your own private pool and bar which is amazing. The main pool bar is great to, the bartenders were the best.
reviews.title: Fancy Clean Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing is being younger this resort almost felt too fancy. Everything is marble so if it is raining or after getting out of the shower be careful, falling is very likely. Also, if a disco is high on your list this may not be the resort for you. The resort is amazing, the beach is amazing, the only thing I would recommend work on is the night life. The resort says that there is a 24 hour snack bar but really there isn't and the lobby bar isn't the greatest. Overall, a great resort though. Be prepared to do some walking though because it is quite large.
reviews.title: I WILL BE BACK!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyone reading, listen up. LISTEN UP. This hotel blew me away- I have been to Brazil, Aruba, Bahamas (Atlantis), Puerto Rico- you name it.
reviews.title: beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely fantastic- I dont have one bad thing to say about it.
reviews.title: great resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The negative reviews are written by snobbish, snide, arrogant people that I probably wouldnt like in my daily life, let alone my vacation.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I must say i read many reviews on tripadvisor prior to my trip to the grand sunset princess and the negative reviews did worry me a little however i had nothing to worry about as soon as we reached the resort. We traveled as a large group of 27 for a wedding which was also held at the resort.
reviews.title: Amazing Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From day one when we arrived at check in to day 7 at check out there is not a single complaint that i have about anything and i wonder what those who are complaining are expecting?
reviews.title: Mixed bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort grounds are up kept and beautiful; i notice someone cleaning or maintaining the building almost every 10 feet. Rooms were very clean as well.
reviews.title: Good overall but has room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: All restaurants were great however try getting into the Miso - tepanyaki as it books up very quickly but is awesome food and great entertainment!
reviews.title: AMAZING RESORT, FRIENDLY STAFF, PERFECT HONEYMOON!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole resort had really great service and amazing staff. Bartenders were great and would give you great service.
reviews.title: Fabulous vacation
Best Vacation Ever
reviews.text: My husband, 11 yr old, 19 yr old and 66 yr old mother went late July. First off hardly any mosquitos not sure what everyone is talking about- also regarding the beach if you knew how to read english you would see the sign at the beach front that says "Red Mangrove" that is why parts of the water were brown and had a slight smell, it is natural and the marine life need this to thrive- all you have to do is travel to the right or left of the mangrove and you find clean, clear and beautiful waters. We did not have one bad experience here, well I did fall and hurt my shoulder but no shoes and a few drinks were the reason, wear good gripping shoes the pool walkways get slippery and the resort is all marble floors- just be careful. The staff work very hard, are very friendly and smile all the time- our balcony was facing the service road- all day the workers used this path- as they walked they joked and smiled with each other, truly happy with there jobs and not overworked but wow how they kept the grounds maintenaced. The nightly entertainment was wonderful, food good, pool wonderful, our pool bar had a bartendar named Felix- gotta love him. We walked a lot but there is a shuttle available for those that want to be lazy. My mom at the age of 66 had a blast, she had a swim out room right by the pool bar- a little loud and busy due to the music and games but we enjoyed every part of it. The pool entertainment always made you laugh until you had to pee. There is a local gator by the Asian restaurant, along with many local lizards and iguanas- not at all like Cancun this is the jungle baby. By the kids club there is a family of spider monkeys too I am assuming they live there so they can play on the swings and such at night. I would go back today if I could and my family feel the same.The only problem with this resort is that Mexico's drinking age is 18 - my 19 yr old took full advantage of this- he hung out in the sports bar and disco quite a few nights- he had a blast met lots of friends and was always grinning from ear to ear. I made him carry his drivers license whey he was out and about at night in case something happened. Other than that I had a stress free vacation.

reviews.title: Amazing Vacation and SUPER CLEAN!
reviews.text: I could not believe how clean this resort is. For it being so huge, they work VERY hard to keep it clean....I even saw a guy in the pool with a toothbrush scrubbing the individual tiles. They even cleaned the statues in the middle of the resort. Our stay was amazing and we really did not have many complaints. I think they could have arranged the dinner reservations a little better because we were only able to get 2 reservations because the others were all booked. The food is just so-so in the buffet but I believe that is because they are trying to accommodate so many different cultures at one time. Breakfast was definitely the best of the meals. During lunch they have a grill outside the pool area with fresh hamburgers and hot dogs that was amazing. Not a very long wait because the meat is being cooked quickly. It was a great alternative while you laying by the pool or the beach. The cabanas near the beach and pool are first come first serve but most people are pretty nice about letting you know they are leaving so you can grab their spot. It is really hot so its a great idea to grab one of those if you can. All in all we loved our vacation but the one thing you MUST do is GO INTO THE CITY! We traveled into Playa Del Carmen one night and we took a taxi there and back. We ate at Ajua which is a cute little restaurant owned by a women from TX. They cooked your food in the middle of the street for you and it was a great experience. Then we went into the shops on 5th avenue and it was amazing. Reminded me a lot of New Orleans with all of the little shops and great nightlife. Definitely a must-see when visiting any of the resorts in the area.

reviews.title: Trip of a Life time!!!!
reviews.text: The Grand Sunset Princess was absolutely stunning! we all loved it! my daughter who is 18 years old had an amazing time especially at night dancing with all the dancers playing games on stage. The resort, yes it is big... and it requires a lot of walking, but by the second night we found the shuttle bus that took us right in front of your room. which by the way is perfect especially at night when you have had a few drinks and wouldn't really make it to your room without it!! ha ha...we stayed on the sunset side of the resort,in the junior suit which was fine for us considering the only time we were in the room was when we had to sleep. when you go out to the pool , the whole pool raps around the resort so you never have to get out the pool. even when you want drinks there is a pool bar, and lots of great and fun pool entertainment. even if you don't want to be near all the entertainment and you want to stay in a quieter place there are people always coming around getting you drinks, and refilling them for you. The nightly entertainment was amazing...i know my daughter really enjoyed the grease show...and the acrobats were really cool too, and a lot of fun to watch! the food is good in the buffet. As for the a la carts they were okay the one we enjoyed the most was the Italian restaurant called mama mia, and the vaqueria which is a grill place. The beach was gorgeous!!!!! if you like a place with white sandy beaches...i would definitely recommend this place!!!!! the people are very friendly and hard working. every morning you would see them working hard to maintain the place. it was the vacation of a lifetime!!!!!!

reviews.title: Don't judge a book by its cover... (Long, personal review)
reviews.text: I have mixed reviews and feelings on this resort. My husband and I went down on a Monday for our honeymoon and had 10 of our friends join us on the Wednesday. Upon arrival everything was great! Fast and friendly check - in, an upgrade for the honeymoon and the front desk employee even looked up each of our friends to put us all close together. We were given a map and told that a shuttle ran every 15 minutes, although the direction to where the shuttle actually was wasn't very clear. We decided to walk to our room and were told that our luggage would arrive within 15 minutes.

reviews.title: Just the facts Ma'am
reviews.text: Upon arriving in our room everything looked wonderful. Very spacious, clean and a great view. Our luggage arrived very quickly and we got ready for the pool and took a walk to the 24/7 Sports Bar for the some food since the buffet wasn't open yet. However, upon returning that evening back to our room there was an annoying banging in the ceiling of the bathroom. The noise continued for two nights and became louder and louder. The third morning I went to the front desk to complain and the lady said someone would be there in 10 minutes and would someone be in the room. I said yes and headed immediately back. After waiting an hour I went down to the pool while my husband stayed. I came back after 2 hours to see where he was, he was still waiting. I called back to the front desk and talked to the same girl. I told her that 10 minutes had now been 3 hours and still no one had come to the room and we didn't want to spend our entire day waiting. Service arrived within 5 minutes and he looked around and listened and made a call and opened the ceiling. This took another hour or so and then we were told they had to fix this on the roof and it would take about 30 minutes. We went to the pool and came back a couple hours later to check. Still noisy, if not worse, and so I called again. Again I spoke to the same girl who let me go to call service. She called back about 15 minutes later to tell me that they had fixed it. I asked her if she would like to come to the room and listen and tell me it was fixed. She said the service man would be back in 10 minutes. While waiting I had an idea to push on the ceiling because as it was louder it sounded like it was actually banging on the ceiling. When I pushed on the ceiling it stopped! When the service man arrived I showed him. He opened the ceiling again and went to the housekeeper to get a broom and bend a pipe that broke the u ring holding it and bent it up the other way...he was so proud he "fixed" it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from 6 days at Grand Sunset Princess Resort in Playa Del Carmen.
reviews.title: beautiful resort...some areas need attention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is as huge as everyone comments on..and as well maintained and beautiful.
reviews.title: Over-rated, reviews don't lie: Platinum a joke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can swing it--go Platinum--mainly because you have access to the quieter pool areas and beach area. Buffet food was ok---nothing really bad and nothing really spectacular---more like cafeteria buffet vs. gourmet buffet. The ala cart restaurants all seem to be works in progress---service at LeFleur was horrific while Miso was great fun (request to be seated at the hibachi grills vs a separate table); Argentinean Steak House and Mama Mia were the best.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Place..a few bad things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: The down side is that you have limited choices in dinner reservations---they limit the times and it's very frustrating. Also---to get a chair at the Platinum beach you need to get there by 6:30 am---(no kidding) and if you want to sit in the quiet Platinum pool by the concierge you need to get there by 7:30 am.
reviews.title: Simply beautiful resort with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The maid service was sporadic---two nights our room was not cleaned. The rooms are nice and spacious but the beds are small and have sub par linens and pillows. Bathrooms are beautiful as well, but again, the toiletries were limited and of poor quality.
reviews.title: My first trip to Mexico...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival
reviews.title: Grand Sunset Princess Laguna Villa experience - HEAVENLY!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: Flying from Toronto to Cancun on Sunwing Airlines we arrived on time and made it from the airport to the resort in 35 minutes via a private shuttle. A bus was provided with Sunwing but we find them crowded and slow and it is just easier to pay the private driver to get us there quicker. We arranged for the shuttle driver on the Internet based on recommendations from tripadvisor.com. It cost us $55.00 US but we have since learned that the cost of a cab is only $33.00 US so I would keep that in mind for next time.
reviews.title: Bring an open mind and a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Arriving at the resort we walked to the front desk where there was a special section set aside for the Laguna Villa and Platinum Suite guests. We were the only ones in line and were checked in with our bracelets within 10 minutes.
reviews.title: An overall great vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Initially we were told that the rooms wouldn't be available until 3:00pm but after speaking to the Main Concierge desk for a moment they double checked and found that our room was indeed ready for our arrival. We were given two electronic keys, a map to the resort and were offered the assistance of a bellboy to take our luggage to the room.
reviews.title: The resort is too big and very under staffed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walk from the main lobby to the Laguna Villa section is 1 minute and there is an elevator for those not wishing or not able to use the main staircase at the lobby.
reviews.title: Great place to stay if you're looking to shed some pounds....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Princess for 2 weeks. The resort is beautiful and the grounds are well maintained. We had a junior deluxe room which was a nice room and was cleaned every day.
reviews.title: Lovely Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Food - The breakfast buffet is pretty good, loads of things to choose from. Didn't use the lunch buffet, they have burgers and hot dogs on a bbq by the pool. Did not enjoy the evening buffet the food was cold and anything with cheese on was horrible. The 2 best restaurants are the steak and the Japanese both really good. The italian was horrible the food was cold and bland. The Mexican was dissapointing as I was expecting this to be really good. Did not enjoy the seafood restaurant either.
reviews.title: IF YOU ONLY READ ONE REVIEW, READ THIS ONE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools and beach - the pools were pretty good plenty of sun beds and shade. I think this was owing to the fact that the hotel was only 40% full! The pool bars were good but should be open later than 6!
reviews.title: Unmitigated Excellence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bars - were ok but got a bit samey after a couple of days. The cuban band in the piano bar were really good. But the bars are closed by 11 and 12 which is a bit early! The sports bar was ok serves food and drink 24/7! They do serve premium spirits but if you don't ask for it in teh cocktails you get cheaper spirits!
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hired a car for 3 days which was a good way of seeing different things. Tulum is worth a vist, Vallodolid wasn't! We went to Xel Ha want an amazing place it seems exspensive but thats hire of equipment, food and all drinks. Wouldn't bother with Cancun wasn't much there! Playa del Carnen is a nice town but the shop owners trying to get you in there shops is rarther annoying. Worth going to Senor Frogs for a couple though! Xcarat is a good day out to!!
reviews.title: Went in with a cautious yet open mind (from other reviews) and left more then happy!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I went to the Sunset Princess and thought that it was a beautiful resort. The property is too big for elderly guest or for those with health problems. The food and drinks were terrible. The electricity went off and on for four days and management had nothing to say about it or to even apologize. The management does not care about the customer and don't ask for the owners name because they will not give it to you. The facility is made with alot of marble, so remember marble is slippery when wet. Two guests fell and cracked the head open and others fell with different injuries. Our room was lovely, damp, smelly, and the glass shower had a drain higher than the floor so we would flood the bathroom while taking a shower. After the lights went out we had only HOT WATER, not cold. Now does that make sense. Try to take a shower after fishing with no electricity and in hot water only. WOW! We traveled all day only to arrive after 3 p.m. with nothing to eat until 6:30 and reservations were full at specialty resturants. Buffet it was for us and we could not identify some of the foods. The sports bar had hamburger, but it is not advertized so you have to stumble on it and the queso was from a can. The games at the sports bar were not equiped with game pieces.
reviews.title: Horror Story, the worst service I have ever had. Just say no!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We heard of many unhappy folks trying to leave the hotel and one man lost $280.00 because he did not get a wake up call, so missed his outing. He was yelling in the lobby and I would quess that he did not get a refund, because when we complained about issues we were told to talk with the travel agency. We did not pay them so they would not honor our complaints.
reviews.title: Overall a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Trolly????????? Forget using it because there is only one for the whole property and it passes every 15 minutes if they don't stop to talk. We will never stay at this property again and will tell everyone how bad it. We tried to work with management but they did not care and were extremely rude. Just Beware and good luck.
reviews.title: Not so Grand Sunset Princess after all - The Resort of "NO"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: June 18 – July 2
reviews.title: Lets go again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: AIRPORT
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever !!
most of people choose not To swim in The...
reviews.text: most of people choose not To swim in The océan even before reaching The Water : there is a really bad smell, it really stinks. If you do decide To go for a swim, you will have To wear sandals because The Bottom of ocean is full of big rocks. A guest broke a toe. And another hit hais Head really bad swimming under Water for 2 reasons: The big rocks And ... The water is brown on The first 20 meters. very gross And dirty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I've nothing bad to say about this resort, it was quiet big for me but that is just my personal opinion. The best thing I found at this resort was the kid's club, i have a 4 four year old daughter and she really enjoyed spending time at the kid's club and it gave my husband and I some time to our selves. The staff that take care of them are extremely nice and friendly as well, you can tell they enjoy their job. The buffet was good as well but the a la carte was excellente (especially Las Olas) but most important all the staff are extremely friendly and very respectful. The only complaint I have is that at the time of our arrival we had to wait almost 3 hours for our room to be ready and when you have a little one is hard to wait around for that long. The beach was not as I thought when we got there for some reason some part of the water was brown (apparently because of the rain) but it kind of cleared out in a couple of days but other than that the beach was gorgeous. We enjoyed or trip very much but I am not sure if we would go back to that specific resort, I might want to try a smaller one after.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: we arrived at the resort july 10th to have our wedding on the 13th. we were a group of 11.
reviews.title: avoid this resort ---- nightmare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my inlaws (which are elderly), arrived july 8th. they arrived at the hotel at 10-11pm, checked in at the front desk, and were given a map of the resort and told to find the room themselves. after an hour of dragging their luggage in the dark, they returned to the front desk to ask for an escort. the front desk told them that they dont escort people to their room, and they pointed in the direction my inlaws should be walking. fortunately, one of the guests which overhead the discussion, offered to help them.
reviews.title: Great for Vacation but don't try to plan your wedding here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: when we, and the rest of the wedding group / party arrived on july 10th, (after a 2hr bus ride), we waited until 4:30pm to get our rooms.
reviews.title: Love the Swim up suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from staying at the Grand Sunset Princess and I do have to say the resort is amazing! The grounds are very clean, rooms are nice size (we stayed in a Villa) with great amenities. I loved that the resort was all-inclusive (including alcohol and gratuities) so we never had to worry about anything. If you are a platinum guest (platinum suite or villa) you are allowed extra amenities, which was nice. They greet you with champagne on arrival, the platinum club has a dinner hosted for the hotel guests once per week. Room service is free for platinum guests (if you have an all day excursion, this is a great benefit) and they also allowed you to go to the platinum internet cafe anytime and use the computers free of charge. I would definitely say the platinum status was worth the extra charge. We booked our vacation through a travel website which included round trip airport transfers. The downfalls to this resort are few, but there are some.... if you book an excursion (we used apple vacations on the hotel property), you need to prepare to be the first people picked up in the morning and the last dropped off at night because this resort is kinda out of the way from all the others. It is the furthest out, so it takes extra time and money getting somewhere. We did the XCaret tour which was an all day event and did not return to the hotel until around 11pm. The next day we did the Chichen Itza tour which was another all day event and did not return to the hotel until after 9pm. There were 3 hours of picking up and dropping off other passengers at other hotels on each end of the excursion which made a long day even longer. Six hours is alot to spend dropping off and picking people up. Not the fault of the hotel though, just wished they would have maybe arranged that differently. I'm not sure what people were talking about relating to a bad smell at the resort. Never noticed any of that. The food was okay at best.. not great. They make reservations for you at certain restaurants on the hotel grounds for different days. Not every restaurant is open on a given day which was somewhat misleading. The buffet is okay I guess.. but they pretty much have the same thing every day for breakfast and lunch. Dinner is a little bit different. They really didn't offer anything exciting that you couldn't get at any other buffet. The beach is nice. I agree that there are a few uncomfortable steps when you get into the ocean.. but after that.. it is beautiful. Plenty of lounge chairs and areas to relax in. Platinum guests have a reserved area on the beach which is nice in addition to a private pool. The resort is very large, so plan to do alot of walking! There were usually a few bugs in our room, so check the sheets before you get in! to be expected in a tropical location though.
reviews.title: A great place to stay and play

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tips:
reviews.title: Beyond our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are going to Cancun.. you will need about $40 to get to the downtown open air market - Americano Market 28. The prices are negotiable, but we found them to be on the high side for most everything that is purchased there.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the Cancun hotel zone - there is another market area across from the forum shops.. again the prices are fairly high. If you go across the street to the forum shops and go to the shop in there.. the prices are much better and you can find alot of the same items!
reviews.title: Wonderful Trip- Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Playa Del Carmen - there is a shuttle bus from the hotel daily that leaves at noon and returns at 6pm. This is probably one of the best places to do some shopping! The market area is great! Lots of restaurants and shops! Very cute! You can also take a ferry boat over to Cozumel. Round Trip for 2 people with Ultramar was around $48. It takes about 45 min to get to Cozumel. The ride can be rough though.. so plan to bring some nausea medicine. Several people had their heads hanging off the side of the boat! yuck!
reviews.title: Lovely Vacation! Beautiful Scenery, Friendly Staff, Clean Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: From 7/10 to 7/16
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Awesome Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were beginning to feel iffy about the place given some reviews. Let me get this right off the start. If you are planning to go, you'll have a GREAT time. If you're looking for 5 star luxury perfect, try footing $600/night minimum next door at the Grand Velas and good luck.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay! Wish I could have stayed longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009
reviews.text: No doubt The GSP was 5 stars when it started, maybe it's at a 4.5 now since maintenance seems lagging in very few areas. But not enough to make a slighest dent on 6 great nights.
reviews.title: Excellent service & hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: To begin, we arrived passed buffett closure time of 3 PM so we had to eat at the sports bar. FYI, so called 'snacks' iniclude burgers made to order, as well as hot dogs and ham sandwiches. So if you arrive mid afternoon, don't worry. All drinks are free. Only Corona beer is offered. The water at the restaurants seemed fine, and we weren't too careful about brushing teeth, stuff like that. All of us did fine, even little ones.
reviews.title: Excellent vacation – 7 nights are not enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffets were great. Some of the menu items change from day to day, but overall great quality food. We loved eating there for lunch and breakfast. The restaurants were good to great. You have to make a reservation a day in advance, and arrange the hour, anywhere form 6 to 11 pm. Otherwise, there's alwasys the buffett. Of all the restaurants, we tried Mama Mia (Italian), Vaquerita (beef/bbq), Mexican, and the Fondue. The beef at the fondue was unreal, it would melt in your mouth. That was also the case with ribeye and short ribs served at the buffett. Mama Mia's service was good, prompt, and the gnocchi was great. The meal at the other two restaurants took a little longer. Because we traveled with 4 and 1 year old kids, eating at the restaurants were not the perfect fit. If you can feed them first, drop them at the kids center (baby sitting is 10/hour), then you'll enjoy dinner even more.
reviews.title: Good Value - but missing something special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at GSP February 10th for one week. This was our second visit to the GSP and stayed in the Platinum section. Prior to arrival I emailed the resort and requested rooms close together as we were travelling with family.
reviews.title: GSP, still impressed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were placed in the exact same room as our first visit which we really appreciated however our other family were placed in the GRP Platinum building. We were told that there was nothing available in order to change rooms and to check back the following morning.
reviews.title: Moldy smelling room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked back to our room and I emailed the guest services from the platinum lobby and explained our predicament and within a few minutes received a response indicating that our family would in fact be moved the following morning. I wasn’t going to hold my breath but fingers were crossed. The following morning I spoke with the Platinum concierge and he advised that the room next to ours was now available for our family to move to. They quickly grabbed their belongings from the GRP and within minutes were moved into the room next to us. This was orchestrated by Gina Gonzalez who is the director of public relations for the GSP/GRP. She along with the platinum concierge staff went above and beyond and we are very grateful for their efforts.
reviews.title: Your own fault if you dont enjoy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was excellent for our stay. The beach was good but there was some seaweed each morning which was usually removed by noon. If you enter the ocean in front of the lifeguard tower you can avoid most rocks and coral. We split our time between the beach and the platinum pool. I am an early riser so I was down at the beach reading my book by 7am. I did notice that there were always loungers available even at 10am. My only criticism was that they have increased the amount of vendors on the beach. They do not block the view of the ocean in front of the platinum, Chill Out or adults only sections of beach but they do block the other portion of beach. Contrary to other reviews we did not find the vendors to be aggressive at all and didn’t see any time share people. The platinum pool does not open until 8am and they will remove belongings if you try to reserve a lounger prior to 8am.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, but everything else is average at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet food was good. It got a little repetitive by week’s end but this seems to be the case at most resorts. If you ate at the GSP snack bar where Las Olas and Fondue are located platinum guests have the option of eating from the buffet for breakfast and lunch or ordering off of a menu. For dinner we ate at the Miso (Oriental), La Hacienda (Mexican), Mamma Mia (Italian), La Vaqueria (grill) and La Fleur (international). The grill and international were excellent. We ate 2 nights at the main buffet. The staff at the a la cartes and the buffet were also very good, they work hard and appreciate a tip but don’t expect it.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this resort for 2 weeks, in a well appointed swim-out suite of the Platinum section. Service was superb with private pools and lobbies, Internet acces in the room and un-limited a la carte meals, incluiding breakfast and lunch. We also had bar service on the beach and an adult-only section. A la carte restaurants ranged from OK (seafood) to very good (International, Italian and Steakhouse) and waiters did a good job. I sailed a catamaran every other day and they were in good condition. Because we were in the off-season (early December) we paid what would be expected for a 3-star resort in March.
reviews.title: Off-season great deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside is that it is a huge resort. One does not want to forget something in the room and having to come back.
reviews.title: Great place but Platinum is not feeling Platinum...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our 3rd time to Grand Sunset Princess. We requested a 2nd or 3rd floor room with a king bed over 3 months ago when booking thru Bookit. Bookit put the request in and when we arrived, not able to get above first floor and they pushed our double beds together.... We were told that we would go on a waiting list to move to upstairs, and to check back in the morning. We went to Concierge and we were not on a waiting list....but were added. There were also other couples that were told they were on the waiting list.....none of us were moved. Our room was facing the Chill Out restaurant so the privacy from our room was not happening, nor was the view to the ocean. Also, our room was next to the housekeeping room so at 7:15am many doors slamming and voices outside our room.
reviews.title: It's all about location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is very nice, food is good and amenities are great(except they reduced the size of the bottles of alcohol welcome gift for Platinum guests this time....). It is just very disappointing to go to this lovely place, pay an upgrade fee and not get taken care of.
reviews.title: Just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not sure we will return if repeat customers get ignored, that should be a priority to retain happy visitors.....The staff are very nice and helpful, but there is a disconnect between main check in and the Platinum Concierge - or Platinum staff have no power to make the difference.....
reviews.title: Gluten Free at the Grand Yucatan Adult Only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read so many negative reviews prior to booking but we got such a good price we thought we would go for it. We actually liked it here though we did upgrade to the platinum. We thought the food was good and liked the private pool that we had access to. The service was great though we did catch all the servers look at the color of our bracelets prior to helping us and can't help but think we got the best that they had to offer. Not sure about the type of service the people received that didn't upgrade.
reviews.title: Liked this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned last night. Stayed in the Platinum section which we felt was well worth the extra money. Just steps away from your own pool, bartender, some light snacks and the beach. The beach at this resort has the potential to be amazing, but unfortunately they have sold out to someone and have permanent shacks set up on the beach for vendors. I saw no effort to clean the beach. I can handle seaweed as that is natural, but the trash was excessive. I have never seen more trash on a beach. It appeared they had no one cleaning the beach. The resort grounds are beautiful and very large. Not a good idea for a large group if you are not all staying in the Platinum, as it is the smallest section of the resort. There is a lot of walking at this resort, which did not bother us. The shuttle was pretty reliable, but the walk is pleasant. We did have room issues, but remember you are in Mexico and their standards are different from most in the U.S. We usually stay at adult-only and we will return to that tradition, as the adult only's we have been to seem to have a little better quality food and drink and smaller in size. We had a great time because we were with great people!
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds - Average resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The price we paid for this trip was the same as what we have paid in the past for adult-only, higher rated resorts. Prices seemed to be high this year, or course everything has gone up.
reviews.title: This resort has bed bugs stay away, and beach sucks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort seems to be trying to raise some extra cash. We visited with people who had been there before and they told us that a section of the beach that used to come with the Platinum section, is now an extra charge of $11 per day for an unobstructed view of the beach and a bar with premium liquor. How disappointing for those who expected it to come with their Platinum room. They also allow a few loungers on the front row of the beach for an extra cost, otherwise you must stay behind the vendors. Some bars display/offer premium liquor, but you have to pay extra. Not truly all-inclusive.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know that we would return to this resort, as there are so many to choose from.
reviews.title: Nice grounds, HORRIBLE service, food and everything else you can think of.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a week at the GSP the second week of October 2010. We were hoping to travel to Punta Cana but our resort of choice was fully booked due to our last minute vacation. We decided to head back to the Mayan Riviera and give the GSP a shot and were pleased with our decision. We have been to the Mayan several times before and are aware that the beaches are not as good as Punta Cana, Vardero etc. We were encouraged by a friend and other TA contributors to book the platinum section. We travelled with Sunwing and had no issues with the tour operator.
reviews.title: GSP.....Impressed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Upon arrival at the Sunset Princess we were greeted and instructed to line up at the platinum/villa check- in desk. We arrived at noon and were told the room would be ready at 3pm, not a surprise to us or a big deal. Check-in was a bit slow as there was only 1 guest services person working this desk. We were given our wrist band and went for lunch at the buffet. Shortly thereafter we received our room key cards and headed to the platinum section where our room was.
reviews.title: A fantastic holiday!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, spacious and no bugs. It was lacking drawers but had plenty of hangers in the closet. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi tub which we did not use. The shower was big, good pressure and a ton of hot water. We were on the top floor and we had great views of the sunset from our balcony with a slight view of the ocean. The mini fridge was stocked daily and the maid service was good. We were given a welcome basket of fruit, bottle of vodka, 2 bottles of tequila and 2 bottles of rum. The platinum rooms have a flat screen TV, CD player and DVD players. Guests have use of the DVD library. There were only 14 movies in various languages so not much to choose from.
reviews.title: AN HONEST AND OPEN REVIEW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The platinum lounge was nice. There are 4 computers with free internet, numerous chairs a small bar/snack bar. The bar in the platinum lounge was stocked with premium bottles of liquor. You could also get a light breakfast in the morning (cereal, fruit and juice) and small sandwiches in the afternoon plus chips, guacamole and ice cream. The platinum pool was nice. There were approximately 40 loungers including the bali beds at this pool. My only complaint would be that as towels for platinum guests are unlimited. Some guests would gather their belongings and head back to their room for the day and leave the towels on the loungers. The next person to come along would see the towel on the lounger and think the lounger was occupied. My other peeve were the people that took a bali bed in the shade and loungers in the sun, you can’t be in 2 places at once! The platinum section at the beach was nice; it had at least 30-40 palpas and tons of loungers. One morning we were the only people there. Security was quick to move non platinum guests out of this area. There are waiters to take your drink orders at both the platinum pool and beach. We were able to book our a-la-carte restaurants with the concierge in the platinum lounge.
reviews.title: Love this place - Upgrade to Villa worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach at the GSP was better than we thought it would be. We have been to some wonderful beaches during our travels; we know that the beaches in the Mayan are not the greatest. We took our water shoes but didn’t use them. We found if you entered the ocean in front of the vendors and lifeguard tower there were no rocks or coral. The waves were fun but not too big, you can walk out pretty far in waist deep water. We enjoy a good walk along the beach. We found we could walk forever in each direction without too much concern about rocks. There were a few spots with some debris but we just watched where we stepped.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort, relaxing vacation. Minor imperfections.

aka: Grand Sunset Princess All Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: This All Inclusive Resort is located in the stunning Riviera Maya. The hotel is perfect for an unforgettable vacation thanks to its magnificent surroundings. The style of the hotel's architecture blends in with and respects the environment. The interior decor and ample functional outdoor spaces provide the setting for a fantastic vacation.The hotel features VIP areas, such as the Platinum Suites and the Laguna Romance Villas. They are privately located and offer exclusive services, including two Platinum lounges serving continental breakfasts, aperitifs, and premium drinks, along with a concierge, 24-hour room service, a private pool with waiters, and a water circuit in the spa.Grand Sunset Princess Hotel has seven restaurants specializing in food from a wide range of cultures, including Asian, Latin American, Mediterranean, and European. Each restaurant has its own unique feel and a few of them are located directly by the sea.After crossing the spacious lobby, you'll come to the Grand Sunset Princess, located near Playa del Carmen. The hotel features a total of twelve sparkling pools and some have an adjoining Jacuzzi. There are more than thirty specialty restaurants and bars, a lounge and a beautiful beach facing the majestic Caribbean
